NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS

URBANA, ILLINOIS
May 2B, 1954
Mr, Edvard G* Sherburne, Jr*
10 dent Road
Great Neck, Rev York
Dear Mr* Sherburnei
I am very happy to inform you officially that the Board of Directors of the
NAEB has approved your application for affiliate membership in our associa¬
tion.
You will now be receiving regularly from us the monthly NAEB Newsletter, var¬
ious additional publications of interest as they are published, and many other
items. You should, of course, feel free to write to us at any time for any
information you would like concerning educational broadcasting, Ve will al¬
ways try to help.
Enclosed you will find a list of the materials available from the NAE3„
Please let us know which of these you would like to receive and w© will send
them to you.
Also enclosed is an announcement of the NAEB fall convention, announcements
of workshops and fellowships now available* tinder separate cover we are
sending you the last three Newsletters and several other items of interest.
Your certificate and membership card will be sent you soon.
Perhaps the greatest good of an NAEB membership is the associations you form.
It *s good to know that others are having the a me problems you are and how
they are solving them* It has been the tradition with MAEB, in its thirty
years as the association of educators who broadcast, to exchange this sort
of information on a friend-to-friend basis. You will find lots of friends
in NAEB, and lots of people with good advice and good staff resources to
supplement those which you have.
Sincerely,
Harry J. Skoraia
